page.title: 03The Market Square at Newent
page.content: The Market Square is dominated by its stilted, half-timbered{Market House} which dates from the reign of Queen Elizabeth I. The remains of the first Market House is behind a row of shops. The building was restored about 100 years ago by the then Lord of the Manor, Richard Foley Onslow and in 1913 it was given to the Parish. Today the area is still the centre of town life, the old building is a tourist attraction and is used for Town Council meetings and other local organisations. There is a telephone kiosk in the Square and a car park that is usually full as most shops are nearby. To the south is the{Memorial {Hall}built in 1954 on the site of the old cattle market and it commemorates those who gave their lives in WW II, it is used for dances concerts and other events and seats 250 people.
